ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Song Damage
ygData.msgSnippet: Here is what I had in yesterday for Sebilis: Clarity Purifying Rythmns Verses of Victory (Various times Guardian Rythmns, Hymn, Absonant Binding, Niv s) Chain
ygData.messageBody:
Here is what I had in yesterday for Sebilis:

Clarity
Purifying Rythmns
Verses of Victory
(Various times Guardian Rythmns, Hymn, Absonant Binding, Niv's)
Chain of Frost
Chant of Flame
Fufills Curtailing
Jig

90 percent of the time, I weave the 3 chants. If I also melee hand to hand,
that seems to be enough of a taunt that I can garauntee a summons - even
with 2 SK's and a Rogue doing melee. So, I wait til near the end to h2h
melee while weaving the chants. When we rushed the emperor after pulling his
guards out and killing them as singles, I played purifying and guardian with
my selos drum. Even so, he could stick some low level disease on us
(infectious cloud?). Since that really didn't matter, on later rushes, I
switched to the 3 chants. He resisted them so much, I switched to weapons
and melee'd him with Verses and Jig and whatever playing.

We did this 8 or 10 times. One time just as we are rushing the room, our
cleric is saying "really bad PL, really bad PL..." and He goes LD very soon
after we atack the Emperor Chottal (60 necro?). Emperor has a nice spectral
pet btw. Any how the enchanters tell us not to panic and start applying
runes as needed. I switch to lute and heal & niv's. And somehow we managed
to win. Now that was fairly exciting. Deep in the first floor of Seb - no
evac - no cleric and a named boss mob - heh.

So, it depends on where you are and who you are with and what is happening
at the moment.

Sylly

----- Original Message -----
From: "Kevin L. Crawford" <Lyrnia@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, May 24, 2000 10:51 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Song Damage


> hehe you guys that analyze everything to death make my head spin :)
>
> At 40th I have the following songs memmed usually:
>
> 1) Hymn (Face it, you always will)
> 2) Celerity
> 3) Clarity
> 4) Fear
> 5) Accelerando/Jig/Lament/Psalm of Warmth/Psalm of Cooling/(insert useful
> song here)
> 6) Pixie Strike
> 7) Charm/Bravura
> 8) Chains/Largo's
>
> When soloing I change out 6 and 5 for either: Fufil's and Tuyens
(targetted
> DoT's for kiting/charm kiting)
> or: CoD and DDD
>
> I'd say that I rarely use my level 1 to 10 songs except for Jig (which
will
> always have its uses) Selo's and Hymn
>
> Other than that once you get the next haste song upgrade you dump your
> anthem (36th)
>
> Song makeup, for me anyway, depends highly upon the group I'm working
with.
> If we have a shaman I mem my enchanter songs (pixie, charm, lullaby, fear,
> chains)
>
> If we're with an enchanter I go with my ranger set (chains, chant, Psalm,
> Heal)
>
> etc...
>
> I'd hardly say that I use my 1-10th songs more than my others. It just
> depends on the situation I'm in.
>
> Lyrnia Jongleur
> Bard of Norrath
> <Travelers of Norrath>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
> To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> Sent: Wednesday, May 24, 2000 10:26 AM
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Song Damage
>
>
> > That's good to hear. I saw the damage figures and the potential double
> > resist and thought my lvl 30 song might turn out to be as unexciting as
> the
> > level 29 one I just got. It still seems peculiar that our level 2 song
> > outdamages it though. At what level will my songs start moving up the
> > scale?
